body_html:
If you read through, Google felt there were issues with the PR, but this has really been in their hands for a long time. I gave in and installed Linux on my Mac Pro.

It turned out that running data science in Linux was 4x-6x faster than with OS X on the same hardware, for both gpu and non-gpu tasks. Because the Mac multithreading just isn't as efficient.

So, while I totally get the issue folks have, honestly getting tf to use laptop gpus on OS X I don't think is going to buy you what you want, and you're gonna be happier switching to Linux for your computations.

On Apr 8, 2016, at 3:20 PM, Ron Cohen notifications@github.com wrote:

It seems that there has been a pull request pending on this for several months: https://groups.google.com/a/tensorflow.org/forum/#!topic/discuss/yF6g1pfesCM
Does anyone know the status of this?
